title: Ticket #1847: condor_userprio -usage incorrectly reports number of users
description:
When running condor_userprio -usage, at the bottom of the output it prints "Number of users: X", but this number is often times less than the number of records displayed. The problem is by default, condor_userprio only displays records that have been active in the past 24 hours, but the total at the bottom of the report does not take this into account.

Reported via condor-users
check_ins: 2011-Jan-10 16:15   Check-in [19911]: Fix incorrect totals output with condor_userprio -usage. #1847 The problem is by default, condor_userprio only displays records that have been active in the past 24 hours, but the total at the bottom of the report does not take this into account. (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: tannenba
